title: 110_s2471
content: The "USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. It aims to reform the USERRA complaint process. The "USERRA Enforcement Improvement Act of 2007" aims to reform the USERRA complaint process by amending notification of rights with respect to complaints and expediting attempts to investigate and resolve complaints. The Secretary must provide technical assistance to potential claimants and their employers upon request for complaints under this subsection. Complaints submitted to the Secretary must be resolved within 90 days. The Secretary must resolve complaints submitted by individuals within 90 days. Referrals to the Attorney General or special counsel must be expedited within 15 days of receiving a request. The Secretary must resolve complaints within 90 days. Referrals to the Attorney General or special counsel must be expedited within 15 days of receiving a request. Notification of representation by the Attorney General is also required. The Attorney General must make a decision within 45 days of receiving a referral and notify the person of their representation. The Attorney General must decide whether to represent a person within 45 days of receiving a referral and notify them of the decision. The Special Counsel also has 45 days to decide on initiating an action and representing a person before the Merit Systems Protection Board. When receiving a referral, the Special Counsel must decide whether to initiate an action and represent a person before the Merit Systems Protection Board, notifying the person of the decision. SEC. 3. EXPANSION OF REPORTING REQUIREMENTS WITH RESPECT TO ENFORCEMENT OF USERRA. Modification of Annual Report by Secretary in title 38, United States Code, includes adding new paragraphs regarding cases reviewed by the Secretary of Defense through the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve. The Secretary of Defense reviews cases through the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, including those involving the same person seeking employment or reemployment. The report includes the number of cases reviewed and specific details about each case. The Secretary of Defense reviews cases through the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, including those involving individuals seeking employment or reemployment. The report details the number of cases reviewed, including disability-related issues and types of disabilities. The Secretary of Defense reviews cases through the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve, including those involving individuals seeking employment or reemployment. The report details the number of cases reviewed, including disability-related issues and types of disabilities. In subsection (a), changes are made to reporting requirements to include additional recipients such as the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Attorney General. The Comptroller General of the United States shall submit quarterly reports to Congress, the Secretary of Defense, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, the Attorney General, and the Special Counsel, detailing cases reviewed and disability-related issues. The Comptroller General of the United States submits quarterly reports to Congress, detailing cases where the Secretary did not meet requirements, cases where referrals were not made on time, and other relevant information. The Comptroller General reports to Congress on cases where referrals were not made on time or did not meet requirements under section 4323(a) or 4324(a) of the title. The Attorney General and Special Counsel received referrals under specific sections but did not meet the requirements for those referrals. The Secretary is required to ensure uniform categorization of data. The Secretary must coordinate with other agencies to categorize data uniformly and provide electronic access to case files. The Secretary must coordinate with other agencies to categorize data uniformly and provide electronic access to case files. The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to each report required under such section 4332 after the date of the enactment of this Act.
